column4: ok, i just upgraded from sarge to breezy, everything worked almost without problems, except for the last step, which is apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
broken deps with gaim, synaptic, python-apt etc
erm
what?
updated from sarge to breezy? since when sarge was an ubuntu release?
it is not
you should say: I broke my sarge install when I was tryng to change my distro to ubuntu
well, someone else did it on ubuntuforums, and so i did
i dont think you have anything to teach me
hmm, I thing dpkg's ubuntu factoid is more clear on that
I doubt that you will learn anything usefull other than debian != ubuntu
almost
but maybe you could educate me: what's the point in such an "upgrade" ?
prevent data loss while preventing data backup when changing distro
there are at least several way better ways of acheiveing the goal you described
did i told you it went almost perfectly ?
broken deps with gaim, synaptic, python-apt etc <-- you call this "almost perfect"
I call it "broken system"
a amtter of perspective
do you have libsdl-dev installed?
ohh, no, ill try with that
in general, when building packages you need the -dev packages installed
